section.title: Download
section.p: Releases may be downloaded from Apache mirrors.
On the mirror, all recent releases are available, but are not guaranteed to be stable. For stable releases, look in the stable directory.

section.title: Release Notes
section.p: Release notes for Hadoop releases are available in Jira.

section.title: 25 July, 2007: release 0.13.1 available
section.p: This fixes critical bugs in the 0.13.0 release.

section.title: 8 June, 2007: release 0.13.0 available
section.p: In addition to new features, this release contains significant performance and reliability improvements. For example, MapReduce sort performance on large clusters has doubled.
section.note: When upgrading an existing HDFS filesystem to this release, you should first start HDFS with bin/start-dfs.sh -upgrade which makes it possible to revert the upgrade. For more information on this issue, see HADOOP-702.

section.title: 8 June, 2006: FAQ added to Wiki
section.p: Hadoop now has a FAQ. Please help make this more complete!

section.title: 5 May, 2006: release 0.2.0 available
section.p: We are now aiming for monthly releases. There have been many bug fixes and improvements in the past month. MapReduce and DFS are now fairly reliable on clusters with up to 200 nodes.

section.title: 6 February, 2006: nightly builds
section.p: Hadoop now has nightly builds. This automatically creates a downloadable version of Hadoop every night. All unit tests must pass, or a message is sent to the developers mailing list and no new version is created. This also updates the javadoc.

section.title: 3 February, 2006: Hadoop code moved out of Nutch
section.p: The Hadoop code has now been moved into its own Subversion tree, renamed into packages under org.apache.hadoop. All unit tests pass, but little else has yet been tested.
